info.title: Service Problem Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Service Problem Management specification

parameters.description: Comma separated properties to display in response

parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.description: The Service Problem to be created

parameters.name: serviceProblemEventRecord
parameters.description: The Service Problem Event Record to be created

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the Service Problem Event Record

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

eventType.description: Equals to event type of the recorded event

id.description: Identifier of the service problem event record.

recordTime.description: Time at which the record was created

ServiceProblemEventRecord_Create.description:
Record of the ServiceProblemEvent
Skipped properties: id,href

eventType.description: Equals to event type of the recorded event

recordTime.description: Time at which the record was created

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

ServiceProblem.description: The problem information for Middle B which is abstracted in the service layer from the issued event information by First B

category.description: Classifier for the problem. Settable. For example, this is used for distinguish the category of problem originator in [role].[category] format. ex)  serviceProvider.declarer, supplier.originated, system.originated

correlationId.description: Additional identifier coming from an external system

description.description: Free form text describing the Service Problem

impactImportanceFactor.description: Impact Importance is characterized by an Impact Importance Factor: overall importance of the impact of all the affected services, e.g. 0 (zero impact) to 100 (worst impact). The Impact Importance is a calculated field which is set by the OSS determining the impact.

originatingSystem.description: Indicates where the problem was generated

priority.description: An indication varying from 1(highest) to 10(lowest) of how important it is for the service provider to correct the Service Problem.

problemEscalation.description: Indicates if this service problem has been escalated or not. Possible values are 0 to 10. A value of zero means no escalation. The meanings of values 1-10 are to be determined by the user of the interface, but they show increasing levels of escalation.

reason.description: Free text or optionally structured text. It can be Unknown.

status.description: The current status of the service problem. Possible values are Submitted, Rejected, Acknowledged, In Progress [Held, Pending], Resolved, Closed, and Cancelled.

statusChangeDate.description: Time the problem was last status changed

timeChanged.description: Time the problem was last changed

extensionInfo.description: A generic list of any type of elements. Used for vendor Extensions or loose element encapsulation from other namespaces

@type.description: The class type of the actual resource (for type extension).

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing a resource (for type extension).

@baseType.description: The base type for use in polymorphic collections

TrackingRecord.description: Tracking records allow the tracking of modifications on the problem.The tracking records should not be embedded in the problem to allow retrieving the problem without the tracking records.

time.description: Describes the time at which the action was done

user.description: Describes  the user doing the action.

Place.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as "Paris Store", "London Store", "Main Home"

role.description: Role of the place (for instance: 'home delivery', 'shop retrieval')
